I can't determine how fast you can improve your finger dexterity on the cello, but here are a few additional tips you can try to maximize your progress:

1. break down challenging passages: if there are particular pieces or passages that you find challenging, try breaking them down into smaller sections and practicing them separately. this will help you to focus on specific technical aspects and develop your finger dexterity more effectively.

2. use a metronome: practicing with a metronome can improve your sense of timing and rhythm, which are essential aspects of playing with precision and speed. start slowly and gradually increase the tempo as you become more comfortable.

3. analyze your playing: take note of where you tend to make mistakes or where you feel tension in your fingers. identifying problem areas can help you to develop specific exercises and strategies to target those areas and make progress more quickly.

4. train your ears: playing with good intonation relies on having a great ear. one way to develop your pitch accuracy and ear training is by practicing playing with drones or playing along with recordings.

5. find a good teacher: having a cello teacher who can provide personalized guidance and feedback as well as set up an appropriate practice routine can give you a rigorous approach to improve your finger dexterity on the cello.
